thirdai.dataset.blocks

class thirdai.dataset.blocks.Date

Bases: Block

Encodes a date column given in YYYY-MM-DD format.

__init__(col: int) → None
feature_dim() → int

Returns the dimension of the vector encoding.

is_dense() → bool

Returns false since this is a sparse encoding.

class thirdai.dataset.blocks.DenseArray

Bases: Block

Parses a contiguous set of columns as a dense vector segment.

__init__(start_col: int, dim: int) → None

Constructor

feature_dim() → int

Returns the dimension of the vector encoding.

is_dense() → bool

Returns true since this is a dense encoding.

class thirdai.dataset.blocks.NumericalId

Bases: AbstractCategoricalBlock

A block that encodes categories represented as numerical IDs.

__init__(col: int, n_classes: int, delimiter: Optional[str] = None) → None

Constructor.

Parameters

  • col (*) – Int - Column number of the input row containing the categorical information to be encoded.

  • n_classes (*) – Int - Number of unique categories.

  • delimiter (*) – Char (Optional) - A character that separates different categories in the column. If not supplied, it is assumed that the column only contains a single class.

feature_dim() → int

Returns the dimension of the vector encoding.

is_dense() → bool

Returns false since text blocks always produce sparse features.

class thirdai.dataset.blocks.TabularPairGram

Bases: Block

Given some metadata about a tabular dataset, assign unique categories to columns and compute pairgrams of the categories.

__init__(metadata: dataset.TabularMetadata, output_range: int) → None
feature_dim() → int

Returns the dimension of the vector encoding.

is_dense() → bool

Returns false since text blocks always produce sparse features.

class thirdai.dataset.blocks.TextCharKGram

Bases: AbstractTextBlock

A block that encodes text as a weighted set of character trigrams.

__init__(col: int, k: int, dim: int = 100000) → None

Constructor.

Parameters

  • col (*) – Int - Column number of the input row containing the text to be encoded.

  • k (*) – Int - Number of characters in each character k-gram token.

  • dim (*) – Int - Dimension of the encoding

feature_dim() → int

Returns the dimension of the vector encoding.

is_dense() → bool

Returns false since text blocks always produce sparse features.

class thirdai.dataset.blocks.TextPairGram

Bases: AbstractTextBlock

A block that encodes text as a weighted set of ordered pairs of space-separated words.

Constructor.

Parameters

  • col (*) – Int - Column number of the input row containing the text to be encoded.

  • dim (*) – Int - Dimension of the encoding

feature_dim() → int

Returns the dimension of the vector encoding.

is_dense() → bool

Returns false since text blocks always produce sparse features.
